Title:
Three novel species of Distoseptispora (Distoseptisporaceae)
isolated from bamboo in Jiangxi Province, China
Keywords:
3 new taxa, Hyphomycetes, phylogenetic analysis,
Sordariomycetes, taxonomy
Abstract:
Decaying bamboo in freshwater is a unique eco-environment
for fungi. Three new Distoseptispora species, D. meilingensis, D.
yongxiuensis and D. yunjushanensis from submerged decaying bamboo culms
in Jiangxi Province, China, were discovered based on phylogenetic
analyses and morphological characters. The combined data of
ITS-LSU-SSU-tef1 sequence analyses were used to infer the phylogenetic
relationship between D. meilingensis, D. yongxiuensis, D. yunjushanensis
and related species. Both molecular analyses and morphological data
support D. meilingensis, D. yongxiuensis and D. yunjushanensis as three
independent taxa.
